intro: Hieracium erythrophylloides, commonly known as the red-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish tinge, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It produces achenes as its fruit, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in suitable habitats.
